title: Shaman Priest
description: A story of love and loss, vengeance and death set during Guatemala's brutal thirty-six year Civil War. When a young Mayan Shaman, discovers the remains of his brutally murdered family, he leaves the Highlands and makes his way to Guatemala City, where he rebuilds his life as a Catholic Priest, but, he does not abandon his beliefs in the old religion or his desire for revenge against those who destroyed his life. The priest's dual existence has dire consequences for those close to him including Maria, a beautiful young Ladina with secrets of her own, and Earl Smith, an American on assignment from his government in Guatemala When Earl, Maria, and Espiritu's lives intersect, they are caught up in the violence around them. Guarding secrets of her own, Maria vows that she too will seek vengeance for the losses she has suffered.
author: Karen  Hopkins
